poem:
**The End of the Roll**

Who gives a crap, indeed,  
as puppies and koalas disappear,  
replaced by rolls of bamboo dreams,  
in middle-class bathrooms,  
where colors unwrap like gifts.  
Let us flush away the past,  
one ethical square at a time,  
each roll a testament  
to leaving the world  
a little cleaner than before.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "On a roll: Who Gives a Crap toilet paper co-founder aims for ‘world domination’ It has been ubiquitous in middle class British bathrooms since a flush of growth during the Covid pandemic. Now Who Gives a Crap is aiming to wipe out the Andrex puppy, Cushelle’s koala and Little Duck’s little duck with a more ethical version of toilet roll. Its product, made from recycled paper or bamboo and wrapped in colourful paper, has risen". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
